title: Deadpool 2: Michael Shannon Is Frontrunner To Play Cable
text:
Deadpool 2: Michael Shannon Is Frontrunner To Play Cable Jamie Lovett - 03/22/2017 
Man of Steel 's villain Michael Shannon is now the frontrunner to play Cable in Deadpool 2, according to a new report. However, the report does say that Shannon is not the only name on the list and that a final decision has not yet been made. 
The report also states that Stranger Things star David Harbour is still on the shortlist of actors being considered for the role. However, Shannon tops that list by a significant measure. 
Cable will be introduced in Deadpool 2 alongside fellow 1990s mutant Domino, played by Atlanta 's Zazie Beetz. 
In the Marvel Comics Universe, Cable is Nathan Christopher Summers, the son of Cyclops. As an infant, Nathan was infected with a technoorganic virus and so Cyclops allowed him to be taken into the future where they could control the infection. In the future, Cable was trained by Clan Askani to fight the mutant dictator Apocalypse. 
Cable later returned to the present day, though by then he was a grizzled soldier older than his own father. His primary goal was to kill Apocalypse before he could rise to power. In the meantime, Cable worked as a mercenary alongside Domino, founded X-Force, and later joined the X-Men. 
in 2004, Marvel launched Cable and Deadpool, which saw the stoic soldier teamed up with the Merc with a Mouth for buddy cup style adventures. The comic ran for 50 issues and the team-up remains a fan favorite pairing. Up Next: Marvel Teases Deadpool Killing Cable 
Deadpool 2 is the fourth most anticipated upcoming comic book movie among ComicBook.com readers, with a 4.23 out of 5 ComicBook User Anticipation Rating, it is safe to say that fans are waiting anxiously for these reveals. Let us know how you're looking forward to Deadpool 2 by giving it an anticipation rating below. 
Based upon Marvel Comics ’ most unconventional anti-hero, Deadpool tells the origin story of former Special Forces operative turned mercenary Wade Wilson, who after being subjected to a rogue experiment that leaves him with accelerated healing powers, adopts the alter ego Deadpool. Armed with his new abilities and a dark, twisted sense of humor, Deadpool hunts down the man who nearly destroyed his life. 
Deadpool stars Ryan Reynolds, Morena Baccarin, Ed Skrein, T.J. Miller, Gina Carano, Leslie Uggams, Brianna Hildebrand, and Stefan Kapičić. 
The Deadpool movie's sequel is currently in pre-production. Reynolds will return with writer Paul Wernick and Rhett Reese. David Leitch will direct. Members of the original film's supporting cast are also expected to return.
